snippet: A third huge rally was undeterred by the arctic cold or by the near certainty that Vladimir V. Putin will win a six-year term as Russia’s president next month.
abstract: Antigovernment protesters gather a third huge crowd in the center of Moscow, undeterred by arctic cold or by the near certainty that Vladimir V Putin will win a six-year presidential term in March; Russian authorities are prepared, organizing a simultaneous rally in defense of Putin, at which speakers issue dire warnings of the possible consequences of continued protest.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by David M. Herszenhorn, Glenn Kates, Sophia Kishkovsky, Anastasia Sadovskaya, Michael Schwirtz and Olga Slobodchikova.

lead_paragraph: A third huge rally was undeterred by the arctic cold or by the near certainty that Vladimir V. Putin will win a six-year term as Russia’s president next month.

headline.seo: Protesters Throng Frozen Moscow in Anti-Putin March
headline.main: In Biting Cold, Protesters Pack the Center of Moscow
headline.print_headline: In Biting Cold, Protesters Pack the Center of Moscow to Rally Against Putin
